messages.subject: your nephew
messages.msgSnippet: I certainly don t know laws, but I would think that accountability lies with the teacher who started this whole thing by not allowing a child to eat.  I can t
messages.messageBody:
I certainly don't know laws, but I would think that accountability lies with
the teacher who started this whole thing by not allowing a child to eat. I
can't believe that can be legal, I would think, after having worked in
public schools, & know how important "due process" is that refusing to allow
a child to eat is correct.

Has this been questioned? Has anyone talked to the school board about due
process? Just a thought...
Cindy

messages.subject: Re: your nephew
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/16/99 6:15:16 AM Pacific Daylight Time, jwwjr@neocomm.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/16/99 6:15:16 AM Pacific Daylight Time,
jwwjr@... writes:

<< Has this been questioned? Has anyone talked to the school board about due
process? Just a thought... >>

This was my thought. They can't deny the child access to food, has a counter
suit been filed?

Charlotte
